website_summaries.verdict: A noteworthy option in a lightweight stroller for parents looking for longevity. It can be used with Graco Click Connect car seats or alone for older babies.
pros: This lightweight stroller is distinctive not just for its ability to be used with car seats or alone, but also because of its smooth ride and  fluid turns
We also love that it can easily be closed with one hand
cons: The storage area is not easily accessible when used with a car seat
A few users also felt it was a bit too large for convenient traveling

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this stroller however there are things that are horribly wrong. The back to the seat of the stroller does not lock in evenly when reclining and lifting your child. The foot rest is not much of a foot rest at all. The stroller is listed as a light weight stroller which is is not compact nor lightweight. I always buy graco products and I’m not impressed this time graco!! So sad for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Adela Cansino

customer_reviews.title: Still my favorite
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a travel system but was having trouble with the carseat base/carseat straps and had to be returned. Decided to buy a nicer carseat and then stroller separately, wanted a click connect one and one to use as the baby grows. This one is awesome. Infant carrier was secure on it, we are now using it for just her to sit up in, but the flat "bassinet" option works wonders for changing diapers while out and for napping. Very easy to fold and unfold, lightweight and slim profile. My only complaint right now is we're having trouble getting the break to stick, we can but it takes several tries.
customer_reviews.author: Duqrn87

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller to keep in car, easy to carry and fold up - we have 2!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller for our grandkids - we have one or two 5 days a week. We have 3 with a 4th on the way, 3yo and under. I bought our first one because it folds easily using one hand (when your other arm is carrying the baby), Click Connect seat will fit in, it's comfier than an umbrella stroller, lighter than a regular one, has lots of storage space underneath, easy to push, and the canopy is large. Both strollers easily fit in our car trunk, and there's a nice carrying handle too. Now my husband and I can each have a stroller to push. So much easier to take to the mall than the limo double stroller. !
customer_reviews.author: jib

customer_reviews.title: Nice stroller, good value
customer_reviews.text: This stroller has traveled many miles both in the states and abroad. We are very happy with it. I like that the seat back reclines fully so our baby can nap if we are out of the house for a long time. It is easy to fold and pick up with one hand, easy to travel through airports with, nice basket under the seat to carry items. Really, it's been perfect for us. It's not the lightest weight or smoothest ride, but for the price it's a great stroller.
customer_reviews.author: jillian

customer_reviews.title: This is the greatest stroller I own
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest stroller I own. It is compatible with my car seat which click into eat perfectly and very easily. It is super light, at least compared to the other one I have. It is also fairly small when you fold it, so it is my favorite stroller to take with us anywhere. You can completely lay down the seat, so I can put my son in it to sleep. I can also use it when he gets older, as the seat reclines into sitting position. Great purchase, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alina Zamorskaya

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller because the other stroller I have is a Bob which I love but takes up my entire trunk. So I wanted something that was smaller and easier to use for short trips and smaller for stores etc. This thing is great and pops up easy. I can use with the carseat or without. The only thing is you have to keep it a little bit in front of you when talking or else you will step on the wheels. Overall super happy with this purchase and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but the cheap plastic wheels do make for a bumpier ride on sidewalk which has been our only real disappointment thus far
customer_reviews.text: Convenient for on the go and fairly lightweight, but the cheap plastic wheels do make for a bumpier ride on sidewalk which has been our only real disappointment thus far. Easy click and go with our Graco car-seat is nice. And takes up a lot less space in trunk than our jogging stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmo

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile and looks good
customer_reviews.text: I have the Graco Modes 3 Lite travel system, which is fantastic but, takes up most of my trunk space. I was looking for something lightweight and compact for quick outings. The Breaze looks great, has a large storage basket, love the calf support and bassinet type features, but I found it too large for my needs. If you are looking for a stroller that isn't bulky like the travel systems but, not a typical flimsy umbrella this is definitely the one to go with. You could use this for everything.
customer_reviews.author: Destiney

customer_reviews.title: Great but not that great
customer_reviews.text: If I had gotten this for less than $100 then no complains. The stroller is lightweight and incorporates the 2 features I wanted in a lightweight stroller. One of them is the ability to recline the seat into a bassinet. This way, we don't need a car seat. If we do need a car seat, this stroller surprisingly has that feature to hook up a carseat. My only complaint is the tires are bad quality. I think they are meant for strolling indoor because they are getting beat up after 2 strolls in my neighborhood. The stroller will last but I think the tires are not going to last over a year.
customer_reviews.author: sharingiscaring

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 100%
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is pretty light weight, but awkward to carry. The strap handle on the side , is not a very good idea. Perhaps something to put over your shoulder would be more helpful. The recline is decent and it’s very easy to maneuver. My main issue with this stroller is that there is no rain cover that quite fits on it very well. Also it’s too low to the ground, and I’m 5’1”! This factor makes the rain situation a situation if you know what I mean. It makes the rain cover have more stroller to cover as it widens at the bottom. Otherwise you get what you pay for. Meh 😐
customer_reviews.author: NeverPayRetail

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: We needed a lightweight stroller for travel, after a loooong research I am sure we made the correct decision. This stroller is not only light, easy to fold and has a great storage space, is also super comfy for our little one (100% reclining). I wish I had found it long time ago, I would have save to much money! Also has great wheels, very easy to push. I don't have the infant car seat, so I have no idea how it work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudio

customer_reviews.title: Nana loves the stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Love the stroller. I researched all the strollers, and never could decide. Finally, after months of not wanting to head to the store, my neighbor strolled by with his grandson. Bingo! A chance for a roadside interview. He told me all the features, and how much he loved the stroller. His grandson seemed comfy and happy, so I purchased. Equally satisfied, and there is a bottom storage area for all our pool supplies. We are happy, and stroll everywhere now. HIghly recommend this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jdjax

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is incredible, and buying it before our international trip was the best decision we could have made. It's lightweight, easy to use and transport, and the lay flat seat back is amazing. Our 6 month old loved sitting in it, sleeping in it was comfortable, and I even used it as a changing table when we couldn't find a place to change a diaper. The canopy below will fit a small diaper bag, but if yours is bigger you can hang it from the handles. I do recommend buying a visor extender or a screen of sorts to help provide more shade from the sun and some darkness when your little one takes a nap. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Kanaan

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Love it so far, way better quality then I thought. I bought it because I own a tiny car and have no hatch space (Mazda 5mini van) so I couldn't fit my Graco jogging stroller my son is a infant so I couldn't get a cheapo umbrella stroller, this is the best of both worlds, it's compact when folded, has multiple reclines so it lays flat for new borns, a Graco click connect carseat will click into it like a regular stroller, it's got shocks in front wheels, its a smooth ride and easy to unfold. I love it and definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Make Life Easier on Yourself
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stroller. I use it mostly for going to places like zoo or mall. Sometimes it was tricky to get the infant carseat seated in it right, but usually it was fine and once your baby outgrows the infant carseat, this stroller is easier to use for toddlers. Relatively lightweight, easy to maneuver, and easily folds up to store in the back of my compact suv. Much better than an umbrella stroller, which I feel is flimsy and doesn't have much storage room. We also got a jogger, but found that I didn't use it so much bc it's bigger, bulkier, harder to maneuver, and harder to get in the back of the suv on my own.
customer_reviews.author: Megan E. Mullin

customer_reviews.title: Great for airport travel
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying a lightweight stroller and I'm very pleased with this purchase. We bought it to use with my 11 month old on her first trip (airport and such). It worked perfectly- easy to fold and unfold, has larger wheels that handle somewhat uneven terrain, flat recline, and large basket. Every function is so easy to use, from the brake to the recline and stroller collapse. It is a bit on the heavier side for a 'lightweight' stroller, but it seems very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a “breaze” to use
customer_reviews.text: Really like this stroller. It folds so easy. It is light weight to a point. It’s lighter than the bigger stroller but heavier than an umbrella stroller. The foot rest bassinet type way will only work for small babies, my 5 month old is already too long, but this stroller is much easier and nicer than the one that came with our car seat. I definitely recommend this stroller. Also the one foot brake system is nice. I don’t have to push two locks down, one locks them both. The sun shade also comes down really far too, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: A10

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Well I’m giving it 5 Stars because compare to the bigger Graco we have, this one works great for my wife. It’s more light weight and easy to move around with, if we are not driving and taking public transportation. We still are keeping the bulky one we have for those snowy winter days just praying on no snow this winter because I don’t like the snow. Also it’s great for when my wife is by herself taking the baby to his doctors appointment she doesn’t have to travel with a big Stoller.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Super light and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Works with your GRACO Quick Connect bucket seat, and then can be used when your kid outgrows the bucket. Used a lot when my baby was little and I didn't have the stamina to lug around a heavy stroller. And folds up with the flick of a switch. So easy still don't know how to fold up my jogger stroller so we use this one anytime we go anywhere. Used for air travel and it held up well. Only downside of a light stroller is you can't hang a diaper bag off the handles if you don't have the baby in the stroller as a counterweight.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: I love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! I got it for our umbrella stroller because our other stroller is a jogger and way too heavy. This one is not super light but not heavy by any means I can pick it up with one hand for sure. I love the convenience of it and that it has a decent size cubby at the bottom to hold things. My only wish was that it didn’t have the plastic wheels. At least have some traction on them!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect from newborn to school age!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this can be used with a carseat and it clicks in really well! A little annoying to have to unvelcro and put it together to use it with the carseat but our doesn't take too long. And the one handed fold while holding a screaming toddler is a must! Always recommending as a grow with baby stroller!
customer_reviews.author: natalie m

customer_reviews.title: Really Wanted to Love It
customer_reviews.text: I really, really wanted to love this stroller. I purchased it expecting to love it actually. The reviews were great and it seems to be perfect for our daughter. However, the stroller shakes when pushed with the baby in the stroller. She is only 18.5lbs. I tried switching the back wheels thinking maybe it was the wheels, but no success. The stroller cannot even be used because it shakes that much and is a very unpleasant ride for the baby, plus for my husband and I when we push the stroller. I contacted Graco, but did not receive a response. :( I guess I'll be returning and purchasing a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal L.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. My daughter is 9 months old and we have the uno to duo stroller for her which we like but it takes up my entire truck. I wanted a light weight stroller that I could clip her infant seat to but would also grow with her. The Graco breaze is light weight, much small then our other stroller and her infant seat can clip into it. I think for the price it is a pretty amazing little stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller but not for tall parents
customer_reviews.text: The description says handles are 40 inches but I measured them to be 39.25 with a steep downward slope which means that my 6'5 husband was too tall for this stroller. Other than that, I liked the stroller just fine, comfortable, appears well made and easy to push but note that the handlebars are closer to 39 than 40 inches and have a steep slope. The stroller we are replacing has 39 inch handlebars with a more gradual slope and my husband has been using that stroller just fine for 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: GreenEyedGirl

customer_reviews.title: Real Light Weight!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stroller because we wanted a stroller that was light weight and easy to store. We were not disappointed. We just got it in, but will update if we have trouble later. It is easy to fold, easy to assemble, and it is easy to use with a compatible car seat. Overall it is what we were looking for, if these are the things you are looking for this is a good stroller. The durability should be good based on the build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Langham

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stroller.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our family trip last month. My daughter is 3 about 40lbs and it wasn't too small or too big for her. She slept laying down the whole time we were at Pikes Public Market. We even got a Buggy Board Mini for our 5 year old, talk about life saver in the airport. Awesome stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller so much
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite new purchases. We have a nice having stroller, but it's huge and takes up the entire back of my car, so we were seeking a nicer, smooth umbrella stroller. I went through reviews for several weeks trying to find a smaller stroller that would still turn easily. Love that this stroller reclines to several settings. We can even change our 1 year olds diaper on it if need be. There is a good sized basket in the bottom. Two cupholders would be nice, especially if I it was up near the toddler/baby. But glad it does have one. If you're on the fence, this is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: The stroller is not aligned and it goes always to the left
customer_reviews.text: The stroller is not aligned and it goes always to the left. I have another Graco stroller (when my son was an infant) it works perfectly, but this one it is the worst, it does not turn right and left smoothly so you have to apply a good force to keep it straight especially to turn it to the right. Returning it now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller has been a 'best buy'! When we first had our daughter, my wife wanted a jogging stroller so she could still go running. That stroller has been great also but it's so big! This stroller is much smaller, easier to maneuver and much much lighter. It's easy to unfold and even easier to fold up. If you have Graco, this is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Bregan

customer_reviews.title: I love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. I bought because my daughter was 3minths and we were going to travel overseas. It's easy to folder, good weigh, easy to clean, good storage and canopy. The only thing I don't like is the seat that is not comfy. It's hard on her back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stroller is not for tall children
customer_reviews.text: I love the graco breeze click connect. It maneuvers easily, its not that heavy and is comfy. However, my 3 yo is long for her age and the location of the foot rest is not accessible to her. So to prevent her feet from touching the floor I have to pull the extender out which makes her uncomfortable. I will be purchasing the Joovy umbrella stroller. I really wanted to love this stroller but because of this I can't.
customer_reviews.author: 3xA_mommy

customer_reviews.title: Everything I thought it would be... just needed it to fold once more to fit in car how I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Everything I thought it would be... just needed it to fold once more to fit in car how I hoped. Baby isn’t born yet but it was easy to put together. I did it myself 7.5 months pregnant. The cup holder comes off easily but it should work fine. It is a good stroller. I wish the handles folded down more so it could fit better in my car but I can make it work. The under storage is really good size. I like how it reclines to a bassinet style for new born. And love that my car seat clips onto it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Stroller & perfect for Traveling
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Bought this for our granddaughter for her first birthday ❤️. Mommy & Daddy especially love it for traveling, but do use it as their everyday stroller. Absolutely no complaints. I purposely waited 6 months since our purchase to see if everyone would still be satisfied and everything is great!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A. Devine

customer_reviews.title: Yesss!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve literally gone through 4 strollers and this is the best. It’s lightweight, compact, and has a nice size basket. Plus a cup holder that stays in place! Plenty of room for the little and reclines easy for those nap times! Love this above all the rest and am so glad I sold the others and got this one! bUsing a stroller is like buying a car. When ya know, ya know. And you have to test drive them!
customer_reviews.author: Corey Tyson

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable stroller
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stroller after inhad had it with our other one. We had a three tire, jogger before and it was extremely heavy and the front tire would get stuck all the time and was so hard to maneuver. This stroller is great in comparison to our old one! Light weight, smaller, fits in our car better, and the best part is the wheels dont get stuck! And it completely affordable!
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty great stroller. I love that You can still connect the car seat to the stroller or you can use it without. We bought this to use for our first vacation because our baby was already getting a little bigger and didn’t really want to be in the car seat all the time. It was perfect for it. So easy and lightweight to fold up to put in the car, check it in and if she fell asleep in the car seat, we could just click it on the stroller. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: ... this stroller for Disney World and I am so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stroller for Disney World and I am so glad I did! I wanted a stroller that was lightweight and easy to fold. This stroller was both! It was easy to quickly fold and get it off and on the bus while holding the baby. The fact that it works with our Graco click connect seat was definitely an added bonus. The stroller helped make getting around the resort and the parks so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Moser

customer_reviews.title: Fine stroller but not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The stroller is fine for travel. It is unfortunately not very sturdy. Folding it makes it wobble. Having one closing clip on one side makes it feel like the stroller will unfold on its own. I realize its inexpensive, but suggest you safe and spend the money on an Uppababy folding stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Goryunov

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Loved how I could attach my car seat. My other stroller is a jogger and is super bulky and heavy, this one is MUCH lighter and smaller. Heavier than a normal umbrella stroller, but I wanted it to recline. I'm short (4'11) so I have zero problem with the height. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jocova

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this stroller! It looks great, moves great, huge basket!!! I love that the seat can go almost flat. I'd definitely recommend this stroller. The only negative I have for this is that its definitely longer than expected when folded so in order to fit in my SUV trunk it has to be at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Great from birth up, no attachments needed
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller because our graco carseat snaps in, if folds like an umbrella stroller, fully reclines and easy to maneuver in small spaces...also the wheels come off to make a slimmer fit in my trunk if needed. 3rd kid, had big bulky travel systems with the first and learned my lesson. I wish there were better colors and the basket underneath was easier to get into when its fully reclined.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Avila

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller!! We didn’t want a monstrosity that was too big to store anywhere. This fits great in my small trunk or in our coat closet. We don’t have a graco car seat, so we use as a stand alone. I purchased an infant headrest insert and my 5 week old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: My #1 go to stroller. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this stroller. I’m very pleased with my purchase. Easy to store, fold, lightweight and overall durable. Works well with my car seat and very easy to push (my 6 and 8 year old easily can help push this stroller). I bought a more heavy duty stroller and I find myself only using this.
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Very good and checks all the boxes.
customer_reviews.text: This is way lighter and more compact than my huge jogger. I like Keeping this is my car at all times. Also it checks off all the boxes of needs for my little one. He like to sleep in the stroller and this allows him to lay flat. The only thing i really don’t like is that if the baby is lying flat and sleeping i cant Get the storage underneath unless i put The baby’s chair up which would wake him up.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia F

customer_reviews.title: Good size & seems safe & durable
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this stroller. It’s easy to maneuver & feels very durable & safe. I like the size of it. The canopy works well & I like that it has a mesh area that allows me to see the baby at all times. Very happy with it. It was easy to put together
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product! Only down side is that while it is an easy process to fold, the buttons must be pushed together, at the same time. This makes it hard when my mom has the baby, as she has arthritis and can’t fold the stroller. However, it is a WONDERFUL stroller!
customer_reviews.author: brandy

customer_reviews.title: Must have type of stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best stroller of this type! Goes everywhere with us. So easy to use, so comfy for my toddler. Love the mid size wheels, smooth ride. Quality built. Have it for a year now and very happy with this buy. Highly recommended to all!
customer_reviews.author: LILYdeLILA

customer_reviews.title: Best travel stroller for a growing family.
customer_reviews.text: Great for traveling and going to the amusement park. At Silver Dollar City it worked great. Never tipped with or without my 3year old son. Foot rest is useless but the adjustable calf support worked great for him to hold his legs up and take naps. Plenty of storage underneath. The one hand folding worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!!! Couldn't ask for a better all in one stroller. So a couple of things, first I love how it strolls second I love all the features it can do. Starting with it folds up so easy you can do it one handed. I love how it can hold your infant carrier it clicks in and then I don't have to worry about it getting bumped into and the carrier falling out. Also like how it has multiple ways to set or lay your baby. Has a little bit of storage underneath. So fare for me I haven't seemed to have any problems with it. Well engineered!
customer_reviews.author: Hollie Massey

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is amazing! What’s great for us is that you can put the carseat in it! Haging a 3 year old and 1 month old I don’t always need my big bulky double stroller. If it’s just me and the baby. I just put the car seat on this and go! It glides so smooth and folds up nicely!! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Maci Spillers

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is the best purchase ever. The best stroller. The best just the best. I can do it with one hand while I'm busy with the other one and what makes it perfect is that I little and can carry carseat. It's awesome
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: essential for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an airline flight. It was larger than the airline recommended in measurements, but nobody at the airport mentioned that and it didn't seem to be a problem. It folds easily, but two hands are needed. My carseat snapped in. This sometimes takes a bit of effort to get in the perfect position to do so, but with much practice, it becomes easier. It easily folds up for travel or to just throw in the back of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Blessed MamA

customer_reviews.title: Travel must have
customer_reviews.text: We bought this stroller for our trip to Alaska with our 8 month old and I was so happy with our purchase. We had no issues gate checking at the airport. We were on and off buses the whole trip and the super simple umbrella-like fold design made it so easy! Our baby girl love that the seat could recline and made it easy for her to nap. I definitely recommend this stroller to any traveling parent!
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! If you've got a short 2 yr old lol!
customer_reviews.text: So I LOVE THIS STROLLER!! I rated it 5 stars because it's all around a really good investment! I love the sturdy control and smooth ride my 2 yr old has and she loves it too! I'll update with pics later! 😊 The only thing I will add as a dislike is: -didnt have the snaps to attach the brake wire in the back to hold it in place. -either its smaller than advertised, or my 2 yr old is really long for her age!😂 -the material is also different than the pics, but now I wont have to worry about spills absorbing into the seat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought it recently and I am happy with it. However, there is one small improvement which if done can make this product better. The bottom straps which comes between the legs of the kid should be made wider and padded. That would make the ride more comfortable for baby and parents.
customer_reviews.author: Kumar Saket

customer_reviews.title: It's all worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this stroller. Used it with the Graco click connect carseat.. we don't have to disturb the baby should he fall asleep while in the car. Just click connect the carseat to the stroller and the double canopy keeps ur baby from light and other distractions offering him a comfortable sleep while u enjoy your outing! I travelled to Europe with this stroller and it was a life saver! Sturdy, reliable and safe and great value for money!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Grace Stroller
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 3 feet tall and weight 38 pounds is a perfect car for her. It's not that heavy and looks durable. We are happy to arrive early, just 1 day before we travel to South Korea. Here it is working perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Y.

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stroller! It fits most Graco car seats and lightweight. I needed a lighter stroller to easily carry along since the stroller set with my car seat was bulky and heavy. This stroller not only light and saves space when folded, it also fits my car seat!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy D!

customer_reviews.title: Nice stroller and good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked that this stroller it's super easy to maneuver, I bought it to use it with my baby's click connect car seat, also the price was not that bad, my only complaint is that you don't have enough space where to put your diaper bag or your purse, etc. It is a really small and tight compartment. But overall I'm pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mary V.

customer_reviews.title: Good value but not a light weight one...
customer_reviews.text: Well this is a very strong stroller i must say....but the only thing is who are looking for light weight stroller like me its not for them...i bought it will be very light which its not at all.... I heavy enough to carry for women during traveling alone.
customer_reviews.author: Farhana

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I love the reclining back and the ...
customer_reviews.text: This stroller rides as smooth as an ole school Cadillac! Love it! I love the reclining back and the height is perfect for my 5'7" frame and my husbands 6' frame. My son seems very comfortable in it, no crying or fuss when he's in it.
customer_reviews.author: AGB

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: The handle when it is collapsed seems very loose. But when in use it seems to be fine. This is exactly what I’ve been looking for. I can attach a graco click connect car seat yet it’s so nice and compact when folded. Definitely not hat we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara P

customer_reviews.title: I love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! We already had a full size stroller that came with the carseat, but we needed a second more compact stroller. This was the answer to that problem! It's compact, light, and it fits my infant carseat like a dream! Couldn't be more pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jordanxjennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller as a second stroller and chose it due to its ability to lay down and become an infant bassinet. For the price and size it has a lot of great features. It's lightweight, easy to maneuver, and compatible with our Graco car seat. So easy to fold. It doesn't have some of the comfort features for parents of other, more expensive models, but is a great stroller, especially for compact spaces.
customer_reviews.author: AmLomb13

customer_reviews.title: The stroller glides so easily and is pretty light weight
customer_reviews.text: The stroller glides so easily and is pretty light weight. I only wish there were clasps on both sides to hold it closed. I love the quick connect which allows me to drop my car seat right in.
customer_reviews.author: JasmineR

customer_reviews.title: Daily stroller
customer_reviews.text: We use this stroller everywhere . It’s compact and easy to use ! Sits our daughter upright the way she likes and reclines when she falls asleep . The only thing I’d ask if they can make a version that can flip facing the parents .
customer_reviews.author: Irish Limuaco

customer_reviews.title: I am a grandmother who needed something easier to use and this stroller was it.
customer_reviews.text: I was having difficulty with the bulkiness of the stroller used regularly. Due to my age and an old shoulder injury, I needed something easier to use.This one works so much better, the handles are more ergonomic, My 11 month old grandson seemed to enjoy his ride and finally fell asleep in the stroller. Good stroller overall, still a bit heavy but portable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller for a busy mother on the move who ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stroller for a busy mother on the move who rides light rail and bus. It is light weight and the handle are perfect for short or tall person. I had am umbrella stroller prior to purchasing this stroller and my back was always hurting. My back is no longer hurting.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie  Christian

customer_reviews.title: Must have stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. So easy to use, small enough to easily fit in the trunk of my suv, and lightweight so I can easily pick it up by the handle. Would definitely recommend this stroller. I use it everyday to bring my little one out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Good product. I love the fact that the Graco Car seat connects to the stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that the graco car seat can connect to this stroller. It’s definitely easy to put together. Easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Bussey

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! The only thing is that after several dozen times of use, the closing mechanism doesn't always work on the first try. Before it messed up, it was SO easy to fold up! It really is lightweight, maneuvers well, and fits my graco carseat perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: B C

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is fabulous. It is comfortable for baby and adjusts to various sizes. We use it primarily to travel. It's a little difficult to breakdown one-handed and does require the help of a stranger if you are trying to hold your baby and get the stroller ready...but it's been perfect for us otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Alex H.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and light weight. Keeps my little guy safe. Easy to maneuver and easy to fold when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Christian j canen

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is my everyday, everywhere stroller! I use it in restaurants (easy to fold and place under table), stores and just about anywhere I have to go and spend any time. Lightweight, easy to fold, easy to open. You will not regret buying it. Since buying it I have not used my bigger stroller except for walks around the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: A Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller
customer_reviews.text: I had this insane expensive jogger stroller and it was insane to lug around. Once my son got around 9 months I invested in this because it’s so much easier for just errands or park days.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Voulo

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: While this stroller is not as lightweight as I originally intended on buying, is sturdy and has an adjustable leg rest that most umbrella strollers don't. It's also compatible with the Graco infant carseat.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel!!
customer_reviews.text: I love almost everything about this stroller. We previously bought a Summer infant stroller which was almost perfect. This is even better. It makes travel easy with the click connect car seat and folds with one hand. I especially love the position of the handles more than the Summer. And it also covers more of our baby with the shade. I’d recommend it to any Graco lover!
customer_reviews.author: Abraham Wilson

customer_reviews.title: In love!!
customer_reviews.text: The best umbrella stroller!!! I love it worth every dollar!! Great for baby and toddler super easy to fold also great height I am 5 '3 and it's a very good height for me my husband is way taller then me and is a great height for him. Would recommend to anyone!! Also super smooth to push!! And stylish to!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller! We've looked at so many strollers and did not like how big/bulky most of them are. This one is light weight and easy to use! Works great with the click connect car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for on the go, is easier to fold down then to open, and love that it goes all the way flat for on the go naps. Has survived 6 flights so far as well, so very durable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good stroller with some cons
customer_reviews.text: great stroller but 3 cons IMHO for it being perfect for my lil one 1. heavier than expected 2. it can not stand by itself 3. no kid's tray
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller ever!
customer_reviews.text: It is super light, nice, easy to open and close and big enough for my 3 and 1/2 child. It reclines all the way down and he can have his naps, too. I have to admit it is much better than my last Maclaren and worth every dollar. It is a good value for money
customer_reviews.author: Rosanna

customer_reviews.title: very easy to fold and unfold
customer_reviews.text: The stroller itself is really light. very easy to fold and unfold. the only thing I give it 4 stars is because you need two hands to maneuver instead of one in some strollers.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. JBG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller with the click connect. I am so glad we bought it as the jogging is too bulky to take everywhere. This snaps open and closed and is a lifesaver for quick trips around town.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M. Akers

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a "replacement" stroller for 3/12 year old granddaughter! Amazed how super easy it was for Gramma to put together right out of the box, lightweight, and super easy to close -- all huge pluses!! Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Light weight. Easy to maneuver!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller best investment ever! Bettervthan the joovy! So light weight and easy to maneuver! Very happy with my purchase. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: WISH I'd gotten this with the Snugride car seat rather than a full jogging stroller travel system! Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Kslrsa

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller
customer_reviews.text: I like virtually everything about this stroller, it’s just a little bit too short. I have to bend over slightly to push it (I’m 5’6). Otherwise it is great!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Great features
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, easy to fold/unfold. Love that it lays completely flat and feet come up, I think this will work wonders for all of our Disney trips vs our other strollers
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Latch to collapse the stroller jammed
customer_reviews.text: We liked this stroller very much at first -- it rolled smoothly, turned easily, and folded and unfolded easily. After just a few uses, however, the latch to collapse the stroller started jamming, and has become almost impossible to operate. We have been in a couple of situations in parking lots where we weren't sure if we'd be able to fold the stroller to fit it into our car to go home, and only barely got it to collapse after pulling on it with all our strength. Wondering if this is an unusual glitch for our particular stroller, but currently disappointed since a stroller that doesn't fold is difficult to transport and fairly inconvenient to use on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Highly highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: It fully reclines easily .. super comfortable. Big canopy. Easy to close
customer_reviews.author: Dannnnn

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: In the directions it didn't say you needed to lift on the bottom with your foot when folding. It's supposed to be one hand fold, not one hand and one foot. Doesn't handle bumps well. Other than that I love it, it's very light and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to travel with
customer_reviews.text: Light weight! Is a little long so it does have to go a littler slanged in my trunk. The brake could be better, often it is difficult. Other than that I love this stroller! Easy to break down. My son loves to be Reclined for his naps. Very easy to travel with!
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Made a great choice. Love the look and very sturdy. My daughter is 14 months and it's very roomy. Very smooth and the wheels swivels very nicely on turns .. Very pleased with this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Tori

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!
customer_reviews.text: Love how we can put our carrier in wish I would’ve bought this than a reg big stroller.
customer_reviews.author: mikeayala

customer_reviews.title: love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: its a pretty decent stroller for the price. downside is that unable to use storage basket when baby in car seat .
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I love how compact it is, light, and easy to open an fold.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: We love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: We love this stroller! It's lightweight, sturdy, easy to fold and unfold, easy to maneuver, and seems comfortably for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: They enjoyed the compact light weight feature
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift to Son and daughter in law for a trip with a baby. They enjoyed the compact light weight feature. I see it often in their pictures.
customer_reviews.author: NanaBranam

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Easy to open, fold, carry and steer while holding a baby. I like it better than my Britax single and for the price, you can’t beat it. It’s technically an umbrella stroller but you won’t notice a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Unzicker

product_meta.title: Graco Breaze Click Connect Stroller, Pierce
product_meta.description: Color:PierceGraco's Breaze Click Connect is the easiest folding umbrella stroller, thanks to its innovative one-hand fold. Breaze accepts all Graco Click Connect infant car seats, excluding TRUESHIELD side-impact protection infant car seats, and it holds a child from birth to 50 lbs. for years of use. An extra-large canopy with UV 50 protection and pop-out visor offers shade from the sun and adjustable calf support keeps baby comfortable. It features lockable front-swivel wheels with suspension and, once folded, it automatically locks and has a carry strap. A removable parent cup holder and easy-access, extra-large storage basket make this a full-featured stroller without compromise. Never use bleach
feature_bullets: Ultra-easy one-hand fold makes this the perfect accessory to get out and about with baby
Easily accepts all Graco Click Connect infant car seats, excluding TRUESHIELD side-impact protection infant car seats, with a secure one-step attachment to create your own travel system.
Lightweight, sturdy frame for maximum portability, making it ultra-convenient for moms on-the-go
Holds a child up to 50 Pound, for years of comfortable strolling
Multi-position, reclining seat lies flat, accommodating your child from birth to 50 Pound
